Source code for Signals

#For GUI to sim

[docs]class ResetSignal:
    def __init__(self):
        self.signame = "RESET"




[docs]class ExitSignal:
    def __init__(self):
        self.signame = "EXIT"




[docs]class VarChangeSignal:
    def __init__(self):
        self.signame = "VARCHANGE"
        self.var = dict()



###For outgoing to GUI


[docs]class SyncMode:
    def __init__(self):
        self.cmd = "ASYNC"
        self.async = False




[docs]class OpenFrame:
    def __init__(self):
        self.signame = "OPENFRAME"
        self.layout = 1
        self.defaults = []



[docs]class NewDynamicVariable:
    def __init__(self):
        self.signame = "NEWDYNAMICVAR"
        self.varname = ""




[docs]class SetFrameTime:
    def __init__(self, time):
        self.signame = "SETTIME"
        self.time = time




[docs]class SimData:
    """
    Class for conveying information to the simulation.  data is expected to be a dictionary
    """
    def __init__(self, data):
        self.signame = "SIMDATA"
        self.data = data



# This event manipulates GraphStack.  By default, it will clear the dispatcher list.
# You can also add a dispatcher by dynamically tacking on a codename and desc attribute
# where GraphStack(3,codename,desc)

[docs]class ClearGraphStack:
    def __init__(self):
        self.signame = "CLEARGRAPHSTACK"
